text: plants of the world Hall is a phenomenal
collection of plant and botanical
specimens they're all poured from wax
molds and all of these specimens on
display were poured into wax molds and
hand-painted and recreated to look like
the actual botanical specimen so what's
fascinating to me is that this is kind
of a lost art we don't have anybody on
staff who's doing this exact thing
anymore and yet you have a collection of
thousands of specimens everything from a
tobacco plant to a palm tree a coconut
rope looks like when you're spinning it
from fibers to legumes and and peanuts
if you want to visit one of the quieter
halls I should say it's not that it
isn't visited frequently but it's a very
kind of pensive hall there are these
wonderful perpetual representations of
the botanical world in such an artful
representation
